bug.author: mabounassif
bug.description:
Visit <denchmark-link:https://app.labelstud.io/setup>https://app.labelstud.io/setup</denchmark-link> on iOS safari. Try to tag using the NER. Selecting text and then tapping category does not label the text To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Go to 'https://app.labelstud.io/setup' via mobile safari Click on NER task Select text Select category No event registered
Expected behavior I expect that the text I highlighted via the iOS keyboard gets categorized properly Screenshots If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. Environment (please complete the following information):
OS: iOS Browser safari

comments.comment:
Yes, it's not obviously, but there is a such way to label NERs on iOS:
Select category (this step is the first on all devices always)
Select text
After you see iOS menu with "Copy" "Find" "Share" (etc) - double click on the outside rest of the text (not fast double click!)
(optionally) if you select some text region and want to escape of the selection - press "unselect" button on Result panel.

It worked! As you said, wasn't intuitive at the beginning, but it grew on me. I wonder if it can be a more snappy experience. I am integrating the front-end and I am learning the ropes, will let you know as soon as I would be able to provide a PR with an enhancement. We can probably close this issue otherwise.
